awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Japan Cooperative Research: A Study of the Higher      Classification of the Genera of Alticinae
awd_abstract_narration: This award will support a two-year U.S.-Japan cooperative                       research project between Dr. David Furth, Department of                         Entomology, Museum of Comparative Zoology, Harvard                              University, and Professor Kunio Suzuki, Department of Biology,                  Toyama University, Japan.  The project involves joint study of the              insect specimens housed in Japan, focusing on the collections of                chrysomelids, including especially the so-called "flea beetles" of              subfamily Alticinae.  The investigators will undertake to upgrade               the basic taxonomy of the group by describing the reliable                      morphological characters for distinguishing species and genera.                                                                                                 Dr. Furth and Professor Suzuki are experts on chrysomelid                       morphology and systematics, especially with the characters to be                used in this character congruence study.  Dr. Furth will spend                  three months travelling in Japan with Professor Suzuki to study the             Asian flea beetle genera available in collections in Japan.  This               study will demonstrate the usefulness of correlation of characters              (congruence) to phylogenetic research in systematic biology and                 will eluicdate the Galerucinae/Alticinae relationship and provide               the foundation for creating a tribal system in the Alticinae.
